summary.long: 1 John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: We proclaim to you the one who existed from the beginning, whom we have heard and seen. We saw him with our own eyes and touched him with our own hands. He is the Word of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This one who is life itself was revealed to us, and we have seen him. And now we testify and proclaim to you that he is the one who is eternal life. He was with the Father, and then he was revealed to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We proclaim to you what we ourselves have actually seen and heard so that you may have fellowship with us. And our fellowship is with the Father and with his Son, Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are writing these things so that you may fully share our joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the message we heard from Jesus and now declare to you: God is light, and there is no darkness in him at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we are lying if we say we have fellowship with God but go on living in spiritual darkness; we are not practicing the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we are living in the light, as God is in the light, then we have fellowship with each other, and the blood of Jesus, his Son, cleanses us from all sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we claim we have no sin, we are only fooling ourselves and not living in the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we confess our sins to him, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins and to cleanse us from all wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we claim we have not sinned, we are calling God a liar and showing that his word has no place in our hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My dear children, I am writing this to you so that you will not sin. But if anyone does sin, we have an advocate who pleads our case before the Father. He is Jesus Christ, the one who is truly righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself is the sacrifice that atones for our sins—and not only our sins but the sins of all the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we can be sure that we know him if we obey his commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone claims, “I know God,” but doesn’t obey God’s commandments, that person is a liar and is not living in the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who obey God’s word truly show how completely they love him. That is how we know we are living in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who say they live in God should live their lives as Jesus did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, I am not writing a new commandment for you; rather it is an old one you have had from the very beginning. This old commandment—to love one another—is the same message you heard before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet it is also new. Jesus lived the truth of this commandment, and you also are living it. For the darkness is disappearing, and the true light is already shining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone claims, “I am living in the light,” but hates a fellow believer, that person is still living in darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who loves a fellow believer is living in the light and does not cause others to stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But anyone who hates a fellow believer is still living and walking in darkness. Such a person does not know the way to go, having been blinded by the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am writing to you who are God’s children
    because your sins have been forgiven through Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am writing to you who are mature in the faith
    because you know Christ, who existed from the beginning.
I am writing to you who are young in the faith
    because you have won your battle with the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have written to you who are God’s children
    because you know the Father.
I have written to you who are mature in the faith
    because you know Christ, who existed from the beginning.
I have written to you who are young in the faith
    because you are strong.
God’s word lives in your hearts,
    and you have won your battle with the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not love this world nor the things it offers you, for when you love the world, you do not have the love of the Father in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the world offers only a craving for physical pleasure, a craving for everything we see, and pride in our achievements and possessions. These are not from the Father, but are from this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this world is fading away, along with everything that people crave. But anyone who does what pleases God will live forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear children, the last hour is here. You have heard that the Antichrist is coming, and already many such antichrists have appeared. From this we know that the last hour has come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people left our churches, but they never really belonged with us; otherwise they would have stayed with us. When they left, it proved that they did not belong with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you are not like that, for the Holy One has given you his Spirit, and all of you know the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I am writing to you not because you don’t know the truth but because you know the difference between truth and lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And who is a liar? Anyone who says that Jesus is not the Christ. Anyone who denies the Father and the Son is an antichrist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who denies the Son doesn’t have the Father, either. But anyone who acknowledges the Son has the Father also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you must remain faithful to what you have been taught from the beginning. If you do, you will remain in fellowship with the Son and with the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in this fellowship we enjoy the eternal life he promised us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am writing these things to warn you about those who want to lead you astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you have received the Holy Spirit, and he lives within you, so you don’t need anyone to teach you what is true. For the Spirit teaches you everything you need to know, and what he teaches is true—it is not a lie. So just as he has taught you, remain in fellowship with Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, dear children, remain in fellowship with Christ so that when he returns, you will be full of courage and not shrink back from him in shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since we know that Christ is righteous, we also know that all who do what is right are God’s children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See how very much our Father loves us, for he calls us his children, and that is what we are! But the people who belong to this world don’t recognize that we are God’s children because they don’t know him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, we are already God’s children, but he has not yet shown us what we will be like when Christ appears. But we do know that we will be like him, for we will see him as he really is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all who have this eager expectation will keep themselves pure, just as he is pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who sins is breaking God’s law, for all sin is contrary to the law of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you know that Jesus came to take away our sins, and there is no sin in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who continues to live in him will not sin. But anyone who keeps on sinning does not know him or understand who he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear children, don’t let anyone deceive you about this: When people do what is right, it shows that they are righteous, even as Christ is righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when people keep on sinning, it shows that they belong to the devil, who has been sinning since the beginning. But the Son of God came to destroy the works of the devil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who have been born into God’s family do not make a practice of sinning, because God’s life is in them. So they can’t keep on sinning, because they are children of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now we can tell who are children of God and who are children of the devil. Anyone who does not live righteously and does not love other believers does not belong to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the message you have heard from the beginning: We should love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We must not be like Cain, who belonged to the evil one and killed his brother. And why did he kill him? Because Cain had been doing what was evil, and his brother had been doing what was righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So don’t be surprised, dear brothers and sisters, if the world hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we love our brothers and sisters who are believers, it proves that we have passed from death to life. But a person who has no love is still dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who hates another brother or sister is really a murderer at heart. And you know that murderers don’t have eternal life within them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know what real love is because Jesus gave up his life for us. So we also ought to give up our lives for our brothers and sisters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone has enough money to live well and sees a brother or sister in need but shows no compassion—how can God’s love be in that person?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear children, let’s not merely say that we love each other; let us show the truth by our actions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our actions will show that we belong to the truth, so we will be confident when we stand before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even if we feel guilty, God is greater than our feelings, and he knows everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, if we don’t feel guilty, we can come to God with bold confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we will receive from him whatever we ask because we obey him and do the things that please him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is his commandment: We must believe in the name of his Son, Jesus Christ, and love one another, just as he commanded us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who obey God’s commandments remain in fellowship with him, and he with them. And we know he lives in us because the Spirit he gave us lives in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, do not believe everyone who claims to speak by the Spirit. You must test them to see if the spirit they have comes from God. For there are many false prophets in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how we know if they have the Spirit of God: If a person claiming to be a prophet acknowledges that Jesus Christ came in a real body, that person has the Spirit of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if someone claims to be a prophet and does not acknowledge the truth about Jesus, that person is not from God. Such a person has the spirit of the Antichrist, which you heard is coming into the world and indeed is already here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you belong to God, my dear children. You have already won a victory over those people, because the Spirit who lives in you is greater than the spirit who lives in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those people belong to this world, so they speak from the world’s viewpoint, and the world listens to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we belong to God, and those who know God listen to us. If they do not belong to God, they do not listen to us. That is how we know if someone has the Spirit of truth or the spirit of deception.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, let us continue to love one another, for love comes from God. Anyone who loves is a child of God and knows God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But anyone who does not love does not know God, for God is love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God showed how much he loved us by sending his one and only Son into the world so that we might have eternal life through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is real love—not that we loved God, but that he loved us and sent his Son as a sacrifice to take away our sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, since God loved us that much, we surely ought to love each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has ever seen God. But if we love each other, God lives in us, and his love is brought to full expression in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God has given us his Spirit as proof that we live in him and he in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, we have seen with our own eyes and now testify that the Father sent his Son to be the Savior of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who declare that Jesus is the Son of God have God living in them, and they live in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We know how much God loves us, and we have put our trust in his love.
God is love, and all who live in love live in God, and God lives in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as we live in God, our love grows more perfect. So we will not be afraid on the day of judgment, but we can face him with confidence because we live like Jesus here in this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such love has no fear, because perfect love expels all fear. If we are afraid, it is for fear of punishment, and this shows that we have not fully experienced his perfect love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We love each other because he loved us first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If someone says, “I love God,” but hates a fellow believer, that person is a liar; for if we don’t love people we can see, how can we love God, whom we cannot see?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he has given us this command: Those who love God must also love their fellow believers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ has become a child of God. And everyone who loves the Father loves his children, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know we love God’s children if we love God and obey his commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Loving God means keeping his commandments, and his commandments are not burdensome.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every child of God defeats this evil world, and we achieve this victory through our faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And who can win this battle against the world? Only those who believe that Jesus is the Son of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jesus Christ was revealed as God’s Son by his baptism in water and by shedding his blood on the cross—not by water only, but by water and blood. And the Spirit, who is truth, confirms it with his testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we have these three witnesses—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Spirit, the water, and the blood—and all three agree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since we believe human testimony, surely we can believe the greater testimony that comes from God. And God has testified about his Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who believe in the Son of God know in their hearts that this testimony is true. Those who don’t believe this are actually calling God a liar because they don’t believe what God has testified about his Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is what God has testified: He has given us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has the Son has life; whoever does not have God’s Son does not have life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have written this to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, so that you may know you have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are confident that he hears us whenever we ask for anything that pleases him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And since we know he hears us when we make our requests, we also know that he will give us what we ask for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you see a fellow believer sinning in a way that does not lead to death, you should pray, and God will give that person life. But there is a sin that leads to death, and I am not saying you should pray for those who commit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All wicked actions are sin, but not every sin leads to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God’s children do not make a practice of sinning, for God’s Son holds them securely, and the evil one cannot touch them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that we are children of God and that the world around us is under the control of the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we know that the Son of God has come, and he has given us understanding so that we can know the true God. And now we live in fellowship with the true God because we live in fellowship with his Son, Jesus Christ. He is the only true God, and he is eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear children, keep away from anything that might take God’s place in your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
